info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 11:19AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Pondera, north central Broadwater, northern Meagher, southwestern Judith Basin, southeastern Teton and Cascade Counties through 1215 PM MDT... At 1117 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Augusta to 20 miles north of Townsend. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Neihart, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Pishkun Reservoir, Eden, Fort Logan, Nilan Reservoir, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Sun River, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park and Craig. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 230 and 279, and between mile markers 283 and 307. Highway 200 between mile markers 103 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 2 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 8 and 40, between mile markers 9 and 49, and between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
